thread.title: Biting the hand that feeds them | Opinion - Conservative
thread.title_full: Biting the hand that feeds them | Opinion - Conservative

author: beforeitsnews.com
title: Biting the hand that feeds them | Opinion - Conservative
text:
(Before It's News)
In Germany, “refugees” are suing the government for not paying out government benefit checks quickly enough.
The week-long waiting times for refugees in front of the Berlin State Office for Health and Social Affairs (LaGeSo) lands in court: Around 20 asylum seekers on Monday demanded the LaGeSo the Sozialgericht make immediate payments of benefits. The refugees submitted so-called urgent applications, confirmed a court spokesman. Meanwhile, the influx of asylum seekers to Berlin is not subsiding.
At noon again a special train arrived from Freilassing with around 430 refugees a from the Balkan route at Schönefeld station. 195 of them came first to the Berlin Olympic Park. The others went on to Brandenburg. Before LaGeSo waited on Monday to receive hundreds of refugees. Berlin has since 5 September – the beginning of the influx via the Balkan route – received 18,419 refugees, said the social administration.
Meanwhile, back in Hungary, “refugees” must not be very thirsty.
